title: We had temporary problems searching for web pages on FireFox web search
content: Every time I try to use the search on Firefox I get a message that. We had temporary problems searching for web pages. I get this all the time and if it doesn't get fixed soon I will start using Microsoft Edge.
creator: thogar

title: Firefox and Windows XP
content:
I have a Windows XP machine kept solely to run those applications that wont run under Windows 10, and there are several.

It has a hardware switch that removes access to my network and is only connected briefly to print to my network printer then disconnected as the default. It does allow access to the Internet but that is only ever to one particular site, nominally once per year.

One program requires a yearly update to an internal text file from its parent organization. Previously all I had to do was briefly connect to my network access that file from that organization using the Firefox version on the XP machine to download that file directly to the program that needs it.

I tried that this week May 2021 only to receive an error message from somewhere to "Try Internet Explorer".

I have a workaround solution involving my W10 machine and a thumb drive to transfer that 1K text file manually, but the process of direct transfer to the XP machine used to work, and is much more convenient.

What has changed, such that the Firefox version on the XP machine no longer works?

Ideas please.
creator: jtomlinson22

title: Change keyboard shortcuts without add-ons
content:
There are a few shortcuts which drive me crazy. Say CTRL+SHIFT+C - it is a short for copy in terminal, so I often use it in Firefox, then I see the administration console and inspector. Well, it is a useful tool, but I need to have this shortcut changed to normal COPY text. And there are a few others annoying shortcuts (ctrl+d), etc.

Add-ons proves to be useless for this task. Can anybody help me, how can I change shortcuts via some text editor or about:config?

thanks X
creator: xerostomus

Thanks.

title: Firefox Account Has Been Compromised While Synced Into All My Accounts
content:
I believe my FF account was compromised and an unknown person has accessed my synced accounts to commit criminal activity (stolen digital assets).

Where can I find a log of logins/session history, or better yet, can someone from FF support help me find what I am looking for. I checked for a confirmation email but I suspect it may have been deleted and then permanently deleted from my gmail - which according to Google is unable to be recovered.
creator: ploomstarr

title: micro stutters
content:
hey guys, i am experiencing micro stutters when watching videos when i enable hardware accelerating in google chrome, firefox and microsoft edge. If i turn hardware acceleration off in all 3 browsers, my videos play flawlessly. it's 2021 and there should not really be any problems with high end hardware. When playing games , everything is fine. Watching videos have micro stutters

my system : rtx 3080, 5950x cpu, 64gb ram, 980 pro ssd, x570 aorus master motherboard
creator: hamishraj
